content.question: Students at Hereford High School want to investigate whether they have more school spirit than students at Blake High School. To test this hypothesis, the students will select a random sample of students from each school and determine the proportion of the sampled students who wear school colors to their respective pep rallies. Let <math alttext="p sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of Hereford students who wear school colors to their pep rally and <math alttext="p sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of Blake students who wear school colors to their pep rally. Which of the following are the correct null and alternative hypotheses for the investigation?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub H minus p sub B equals 0; H sub a: p sub H minus p sub B is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub H minus p sub B equals 0; H sub a: p sub H minus p sub B is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub H minus p sub equals 0; H sub a: p sub H minus p sub B is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>0</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub H minus p sub B is greater than 0; H sub a: p sub H minus p sub B equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub H minus p sub B is less than 0; H sub a: p sub H minus p sub B equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub H minus p sub B equals 0; H sub a: p sub H minus p sub B is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.10: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
